captions.text:
Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen, I"m so excited because,

well, see, I love everything red velvet, and
Valentine's Day is around the corner, and

if you're anything like me, you'll be staying
in in your cozy nice house because it is too

cold out and I don't want to deal with crowds
and all that fun stuff, which is not that

fun for me. So we'll be staying in, making
breakfast in bed, and making a really lovely

dinner, Joe and I, but for breakfast, I figured
I wanted to share with you, a great option.

I'm going to share my Red Velvet Pancakes
with a lovely cream cheese drizzle, they are

so good, think red velvet cupcakes but in
a pancake form.

They're incredibly easy to do, you'll require
just a few ingredients, and it really is - it

just feels special, just feels like you've
gone the extra length to do something really,

really special for the occasion, and the ingredients
you'll need are some basic ones, starting

with some all purpose flour, baking powder,
cocoa powder, salt and sugar, buttermilk,

egg, you'll need some melted unsalted butter,
vanilla extract and some red food coloring,

and I'll share with you the ingredients for
the cream cheese drizzle in just a little

bit, but for now we are going to get started
on the actual batter.

Really easy, so, so easy! I'm going to mix
together my dry ingredients, you can double

up the recipe to feed a family of four to
six, this is going to make enough for the

two of us, plus with some leftovers, and here's
a really fun thing, I don't know if I ever

shared with you before, but I love storing
leftover pancakes in my freezer, like I freeze

them and then I just warm them up in my toaster
oven. Pop!

In my toaster, it's not a toaster oven, see
I try to be cool and then I just destroyed
myself.
In a toaster, I like reheating them in a toaster!

So, now I'm just going to take my buttermilk,
which is really nice and thick, my egg, butter,

and then just a splash of vanilla, and I'm
going to give these just a little mix before

I add them to my dry ingredients. Can I get
this vanilla opened?

Yes, I can. A nice little drizzle of vanilla.
And then just give this a nice whisk to combine.

Add the wet into your dry, and now all you're
going to do is mix this together to combine,

and once you have your batter pretty much
together, we're going to start adding some

of the red food coloring, but I want to get
some of this mixed up really well first.

Okay, you can see that there's a few lumps
in there, but this is the thing, a few lumps

in a pancake batter is not a bad thing, you
don't want to over mix this because otherwise,

your pancakes won't be really fluffy and delicious,
and now I'm going to add in a little bit of

food coloring, these are red velvet after
all, if you don't want to bother with red

food coloring, you don't have to they will
taste exactly the same, but, again, we're

going for that red velvet vibe so I'm - red
velvet vibe, that's pretty cool - I'm going

to add some red food coloring to my red velvet
pancakes.
It's like my excitement is taking over here.

And then I just start with a little bit and
get that mixed in, and then you just keep

adding until you get the intense color that
you desire.

Okay, this looks great, now I've got my griddle
here preheating, now I have a non stick griddle

pan, so that means I don't have to grease
my griddle pan to make my pancakes. And truth

be told, sometimes I like cooking my pancakes
in a little bit of butter, but most of the

time I like cooking them on just my non stick
griddle because they come out perfect and

fluffy, they don't overly brown, so I prefer
cooking them on this.

If you do not have a non stick one, you must
grease your skillet or your pan because the

batter will stick to whatever you're cooking
it on.

I'm preheating this over about medium heat,
I'm going to let my batter sit for about five

minutes while this is preheating and then
we'll cook up our pancakes.

My pan is ready, the batter has rested and
now I'm just going to put little dollops and

just let them cook for a couple of minutes
on each side, you know what pancakes look

like when they're ready to be flipped, they'll
start to form bubbles, kind of all around

the top and then you just flip them and let
them cook a couple more minutes and then you're
done!

Keep an eye on them and I'll show you what
they look like once we're all done, and once

they cool a bit, then we can start making
- can I make more of a mess by the way? We
can start making our glaze.

All my pancakes are done, and now like I said
you can add more red food coloring to get

them really, really red or you can even do
green for like St Patrick's Day, you could

do whatever you want, think about this - as
far as food coloring goes, you want to do

yellow, do yellow, it's completely up to you,
this is the right color for me, the world
is my pickle, this is how I'm diggin' it today.

Now we're going to work on the glaze, now
it's really like a glaze meets frosting, I

suppose, it is delicious, you could serve
these with maple syrup and they would be fabulous,

but why not go all the way, I've got a little
bit of cream cheese in my bowl, really important

that your cream cheese is at room temperature,
and as you can see I"m kind of just mixing

it around to make sure it's really soft, I
don't want this to be hard because then it
won't incorporate everything well.

I'm going to add just a teeny tiny bit of
vanilla, more than a teeny tiny bit, but hey,

I like vanilla so I am okay with a little
extra drop.

And then, of course, we need some confectioner's
sugar, because this needs to be sweetened,

and what I do is I kind of just work with
my spatula and just work to mix in my confectioner's

sugar and then I start adding a little bit
of milk at a time, once my sugar is incorporated,

and just mix it until I get the desired consistency
that I'm looking for. Some people want this

to be like a frosting, some people want this
to be really thin like a syrup, you do and

add as much or as little as you want. I'm
just going to add a little bit more, I'm going

to keep on mixing until I've got the right
consistency.
This is perfect for me.

As you can see I've got a little plate ready
for myself, priorities, of course! I need
some ready.

And now I'm just going to add a little drizzle
of this gorgeousness, and you can make it

thinner if you want to but I like it on the
thick side because I really am treating this

almost like a frosting, I know, I'm so bad.
I mean, who does that for breakfast?
I do!
Not embarrassed either.

Because you know what, it's a treat, and once
in a while you have to treat yourself otherwise
you'll go nuts.

That's what my mother says and that is a rule
I have been following my whole life, clearly.
Look at that, they are just so perfectly cooked.
Mmm!

That is so good, you know, you could make
regular pancakes, and that's perfectly acceptable,

but when something as special as red velvet
pancakes are so easy, why not go through the

extra step and make something really special
for your romantic breakfast?

LauraintheKitchen.com has the recipe waiting
for you, if you make these please make sure

you send a picture on social media so that
I can see your recreation. Hope you've enjoyed

spending time with me and I'll see you next
time!
Bye!

title: Red Velvet Pancakes Recipe - Laura Vitale - Laura in the Kitchen Episode 876

comments.text:

simple to make it your own. Laura has a video on it too! Just add a little 
vinegar to milk and leave for 10 minutes, you now have buttermilk. ﻿
